channel.title: Frindlers: First Edition
channel.description: An aural dictionary for the new techneurodelic protologistia. First Edition.

item.title: Preface to the First Edition
item.description: This Preface to the First Edition features audio from Leonard Bernstein's first lecture at Harvard's Norton Lecture series, wherein he focuses and muses upon "musical phonology." It also features snippets and clips from various members of the group musing on the roots of words, the fleeting nature of orality and song, and the complicated relationship between language and music.

item.title: Derouse (v.) /diˈraʊz/
item.description: derouse (verb) /diˈraʊz/ to purposefully diminish or undo a state of sexual arousal or excitement

item.title: Sincerijinks (pl. n.) /sɪnˈsɛrɪˌdʒɪŋks/
item.description: sincerijinks (plural noun) /sɪnˈsɛrɪˌdʒɪŋks/ a playful act or prank executed with genuine and earnest intentions, blending sincerity and mischief in equal measure. usually collaborative

item.title: Davern (n.) /ˈdævərn/
item.description: davern (noun) /ˈdævərn/ an arbitrary, shitty, graceless, or awkward secondary extension of a bar or café; akin to a speakeasy but not secret or clandestine, merely confusingly attached to an otherwise normal bar. Long live Dinky's Davern!

item.title: Zomply (pl. n.) / ˈzɒm pli /
item.description: zomply (plural noun) / ˈzɒm pli / digital text messages or exchanges characterized by a lack of tonal indicators, such as punctuation or emojis, making their tone inscrutable; can also be the result of curtness or briefness. singular form is zomp.

item.title: Zania (n.) / ˈzeɪniə /
item.description: zania (noun) / ˈzeɪniə / a state of mind characterized by obsession or pre-occupation over a whimsical, harebrained project, idea, pursuit, or sincerijink

item.title: Ohhsome (adj.) /ˈoʊsəm /
item.description: ohhsome (adjective) /ˈoʊsəm / extremely clarifying or elucidating; inspiring great and sudden understanding (akin to "awesome" but for a sense of ohhh)

item.title: Techneurodelic (adj.) / ˈtɛk.nʊɹ.əˌdɛ.lɪk /
item.description: techneurodelic (adjective) / ˈtɛk.nʊɹ.əˌdɛ.lɪk / related to or denoting media, phenomena, or experiences that evoke or induce a sense of the uncanny or novel, arising specifically from their genesis in generative or artificially intelligent technologies.

item.title: Frindlegap (n.) /ˈfrɪn.dəlˌɡæp/
item.description: frindlegap (noun) /ˈfrɪn.dəlˌɡæp/ a gap in a language; an opportunity for a new word or neologism

item.title: Appendix to Techneurodelia: The Worst Podcast Ever
item.description: In which Bernstein, Eno, Reich, Sakamoto, DeMarinis, and Orwell fail to grasp the most important question (then again, it's not like we here on the ground have been any wiser these last fifty years or so). There is the technology, yes, but who controls it? Who controls our expression, and the conversations we have about expression? Prometheus was given fire by the gods. The human gods who give us our technologies leave much to be desired. Who are we but what we are able to express — in language or in music? Who shapes and contours how we express ourselves? How can we make sense of strange new feelings? Who is in control of our nostalgia for the future? Who?
